title: Colourful table lamp toggle with smooth on/off animation (React + TS + Tailwind)

requirements.summary: Build a single-page UI that shows a colourful table lamp illustration and one button that toggles ON/OFF entirely client-side.
acceptanceCriteria: A table lamp is visible on the page without requiring any backend calls.
A single button is visible and clickable/tappable on desktop and mobile.
Pressing the button toggles the lamp state between ON and OFF reliably.

file_operations.description: Create the single-page React UI with local state (lamp ON/OFF), render the lamp illustration and a single toggle control; keep all behavior client-only (no backend calls).
Add a composed scene component that includes the lamp illustration and the control area, accepting controlled props (isOn, onToggle) to keep logic simple and reliable.

requirements.summary: Implement a smooth lamp on/off animation with visible glow/brightening when ON and smooth fade-out when OFF, resilient under rapid toggles.
acceptanceCriteria: ON transition includes a visible brightening/glow effect and completes smoothly (no abrupt jump).
OFF transition fades the light/glow out smoothly (no abrupt jump).
Animation works with repeated rapid toggles (no broken intermediate state).

file_operations.description: Implement a 2D SVG lamp illustration with layered shapes (shade/bulb/light cone) whose glow/brightness is driven by an isOn prop via CSS classes (opacity/blur/brightness transitions) to ensure smooth, interruptible toggles.

Extend Tailwind with small, reusable animation utilities (e.g., subtle glow pulse while ON) and/or keyframes used by the lamp illustration; keep transitions state-driven to avoid broken intermediate states under rapid toggles.
Wire the ON/OFF state to LampIllustration and ensure transitions are class-based (no timers), so repeated rapid toggles remain stable.

requirements.summary: Ensure the lamp looks colourful using multiple vivid colours and keep the palette coherent across ON and OFF states.
acceptanceCriteria: Lamp design uses multiple distinct colours (not monochrome).
ON state is clearly more vibrant/bright than OFF state while still matching the same colour palette.
Colours render correctly in modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari).

file_operations.description: Add multiple vivid colours via SVG gradients and accent layers (e.g., shade stripes/base accents/light cone tint), and tune OFF vs ON styling with the same palette (OFF muted/low opacity, ON brighter/saturated) for coherent rendering across browsers.
Define global CSS variables and base styles that support a warm, colourful palette (non-blue/purple-dominant) and ensure consistent rendering for gradients/shadows used by the lamp illustration.

requirements.summary: Add English UI text labels and basic accessibility (keyboard activation, accessible name, and state indication).
acceptanceCriteria: All user-facing text is in English.
The button can be toggled using keyboard (Enter/Space).
The button exposes an accessible name and indicates state (e.g., via aria-pressed or equivalent).

file_operations.description: Create an accessible toggle button component using a native <button> with English labels (e.g., “Switch On”/“Switch Off”), aria-pressed reflecting state, and standard keyboard activation support (Enter/Space) via native button semantics.
Use LampToggleButton in the page, bind aria/state text to the lamp state, and optionally include a short English status line (e.g., “Lamp is On/Off”) for clarity.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent, cohesive visual theme (layout/typography/colours) that complements the colourful lamp and avoids blue/purple as the primary palette.
acceptanceCriteria: UI has a coherent theme (background, typography, spacing) consistent across the page.
Primary look is not dominated by blue/purple tones.

file_operations.description: Apply a simple centered layout with consistent spacing and typography using Tailwind utilities; ensure the primary visual feel is warm/neutral (e.g., cream/amber/coral accents) rather than blue/purple.
Set global theme tokens (background/foreground/primary/accent) and base typography defaults to reinforce a cohesive warm theme that complements the colourful lamp animation.
